byline.original: By BENEDICT CAREY and PAM BELLUCK

abstract: Study in journal Science finding gay canvassers are very persuasive with people who voted against same-sex marriage falls apart; graduate student Michael LaCour, who co-authored study with Columbia University Prof Dr Donald P Green, is accused of falsifying study methods and lacking evidence, and Green admits to mistakenly trusting him; questionable findings undermine public trust in scientific community's means of vetting findings.
lead_paragraph: The questioned findings, published in December in Science, have shaken not only political scientists but also public trust in the way the scientific establishment vets new findings.

headline.main: Doubts About Study of Gay Canvassers Rattle the Field
headline.print_headline: Maligned Study on Gay Unions Is Shaking Trust

snippet: The questioned findings, published in December in Science, have shaken not only political scientists but also public trust in the way the scientific establishment vets new findings.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
